name: Donna Creel
text:
Great service wonderful selection.  5 star
I have bought 3 embroidery machines here and have enjoyed excellent instruction and service.
Highly recommend

name: Elizabeth Witherington
text: I have bought an embroidery machine and a quilting machine here. I love the owners, always helpful and honest, never pushy about sales. She helps me get the machines I need for what I want to do. Highly recommend American Sew and Vac for your sewing machine needs.

resp.text: Thank you we truly try to help out our customers and I always appreciate that they bought from us

name: King Ghidorah
text: Waited over 5 mins before I was asked what can they help me with. Then in the mist of helping me, another customer walks in and just began to ask questions about a product and the employee just stop helping me and started helping the other customer. No excuse me from either one of them. I guess my money wasn’t good enough. Needless to say I change my mind about shopping there. Never again!

resp.text:
Well you obviously have not been to Walmart or places such as that getting help and waiting over 5 minutes 5 minutes is a short time and you got help in person.
And helping someone else as well at the same time that is what multi- tasking.
And I don’t need any customers that need coddling.
because they are impatient and they with my blessing can leave and never come back!!!
Over enhanced value you place on your self as a customer is your problem not mine you got help in person not dealing with waiting on hold on a phone or online.
You got help in person!!!
You waited 5 minutes!!!!

Go to a box store and spend your money!!!!

I have no problem at all with you not coming back. That’s what American is all about if you don’t like something you can go somewhere else and you’re free to do so with my blessing.

name: diane brookerd
text:
I called last Friday and spoke to a super nice man. I described my problem and he assured me he could fix it. I told him I worked quite a ways away so I'd drop it off in the morning (which was a Saturday). He said "thats fine but I won't be here. I'll look at it when I come back". I agreed and we hung up. So I went on Saturday around 1130 am (the man said they opened at 10 am) and the lights were off and door was locked. So I called a few times with no answer. Fast forward to the following Tuesday (I worked from home that day) I went to the store to drop it off....it was about 2 PM. The door was locked and lights were on. Another lady (probably in her 70s) was standing there with me and we were discussing the fact the door was locked and why. So I put my face to the glass and saw someone so I knocked. A young man came to the door and mouthed something about an errand (we couldn't hear him thru the glass). After a few times of yelling "WHAT, WE CANT HEAR YOU" I yelled "CAN YOU CRACK THE DOOR OPEN AND TELL US WHAT YOU ARE SAYING?" well...he didn't...he yelled thru the door louder that it would be 25 or 30 minutes til someone came back. Not really sure why HE couldn't open the door so we could leave our vacs but she and I looked at each other and said to each other as we left that we won't be back. For me it was about a 20 minute drive to get there from my house. The ONLY reason they get a star is because of the super nice man on the phone. I ended up taking it to Fairhope (I work in Daphne) and they were nice and open!

**thank you for such a nice response. I'm sorry it didn't work out this time. I will definitely keep you in mind in the future. All your son had to do was open the door and tell us what he was trying to say. The nite he was pointing to said "will return by 1130". When I questioned him about it he said it was an old note. Also there are sooooo many notes on the door its hard to know what is what. Maybe clean it up a bit. No one will stop to read all that. I'm glad you got your vehicle repaired, that is more important than my vac. i edited my post to 3 stars. Stay blessed!

resp.text: We are slow on Saturday and I am the only one who works on Saturday and I had to get the van to the repair shop and to get the transmission fixed. And I had an opportunity to arrange it Saturday and It has to be repaired and they were nice and said if I could get it to them by Saturday they would work on it this week and the truck air conditioning doesn’t work and the vans does. The truck air conditioning part wasn’t coming in until the 21st and it came in Yesterday and so it was able to be fixed today but when it was ready at 2:00 I put a sign on the door and locked it because the vacuum man and I are the only ones that run the store during the week and if I didn’t get him to take me to get my truck I wouldn’t have any vehicles or a way home I had no customers and the trip to pick it up is about 30 minutes. I have tried leaving the store open with my 15 year old and my husband who cannot get around but it doesn’t work I get 50 phone calls because someone needs something they can’t find or a software question if it was only repair machines to be dealt with I would not mind it but it never is so I told my son leave the door locked I will be back in 30 minutes. I had to get my truck and if I waited I would not have any one to take me to pick it up. You picked the two days that I had to make a decision to fix and pick up vehicles I apologize for your inconvenience but it was a bad situation either way so I left locked the door put a note with my number and my van is not fixed but my truck after a month of waiting on a part I have a vehicle with air conditioning. I apologize for the situation but it is what it is and I would rather be at the store instead of dealing with 2 vehicles and repairs this week but no matter how you feel I after a month I have air conditioning in the truck and it’s wonderful and my van is still in the shop

name: Alexandrea Blackwell
text: I only called to ask if they sold parts I was looking for. When I told the lady on the phone what I was looking for on what type of sewing machine she was quick to cut me off. She told me she did not sell those part because it is a cheap sewing machine (understandable). However what bothered me is her lack of customer service skills. I asked her if she knew anybody who sold the parts. She said no because it's a cheap sewing machine that's only a 150. I get that it's a 150 but not everybody has a 150 laying around. I have only had the sewing machine for 6 months and it accidentally fell of my work table and broke a few pieces. I would rather fix it then go spend 150 I don't have. Mind you I know how to fix my machines so I dont have to pay for labor.

resp.text: A $150.00 sewing machine that fell off a table and busted its plastic bobbin winder off is not worth fixing the customer is likely to totally ruin the machine by taking it apart herself and then not work at all I told her to go to Joanns or Walmart and buy a separate bobbin winder for about $30.00 and be done a $150.00 machine with broken off parts is not worth fixing but if the bobbin winder was the issue buy a separate bobbin winder and be done those machines were not built to have those parts replaced they aren’t worth it

name: Sonya Miller
text: Mike and the folks at American Sew and Vac are honest and professional. He could have told me anything about my machine and I would not have known the difference. How often does the actual cost of services turn out to be LOWER than the estimate? It happened to me at American Sew and Vac. And by the way my machine is working perfectly. Thanks, guys! Highly recommended.

name: Moto Moya
text:
This is a very nice place for people to save their $$.
Let's say your vacuum has a problem or sewing machine ain't working, I recommend you that this is the place to seek for help.
They fix tools and always have some for sale.
If you need spare parts, they do have some too or incase they don't have any, I believe they do order replacements for their customers. ..
It's a family owned business.
The lady and her husband are my favorite people in the area.
They treat customers so good.

name: Robert Brown
text: Great products. Rude staff.

resp.text: Rude is what you make of a situation that’s how your opinion feels however one customer feeling that is rudeness another it is not everyone is entitled to their own opinion

name: Patricia Porter
text: I've been in the shop two times both time I went in the customer service was aweful. They were so rude and neither time I went in did I find what I needed and didn't give me any clue where I could the part. In matter of fact the man that was rude today. Told me he didn't work with sewing machines, he worked with vacuums. So I know I want be going back

resp.text: Parts are not as easy to find as customers make them out to be a lot of parts are no longer available so you try to find what you can some simply are not sold Rude goes both ways in a service relationship so opinions are what you make of them Customers come to find parts here but you try to find what you can but success is never a guarantee.

name: K Butts
text: Rude and condescending to customers. Owners are rude and argue in front of customers.  Misrepresentation of products. This has happened on several occasions. Bought machine 15 years ago there. Because I like my machine, I broke a promise to myself recently and returned to shop for upgrade.  Same story/same page!  I'm still in market for new machine and software.  High on my list of needs is customer service.  I have yet to find it at American See & Vac!  Absolutely will not trade w them again.

resp.text:
Some times customer service is what you choose to make of it how people perceive each other is subject to interpretation it is all about feelings in business making everyone feel how they think they should feel when they shop here.
Misrepresentation is also about how one feels something should or should not be represented a belief of the person verses how someone else portrays the product often is simply a different opinion or view neither way is right or wrong it is all in the eyes of the individual view life is full of all types of people and things sometimes what works for one person doesn’t satisfy another that is everyday life in all businesses.

name: Elizabethann Moore
text: I have had my machine worked on here several times, and the support team has been extremely helpful answering all my questions. I drive from Fairhope to have my Baby Lock serviced, and learn new things about the machine each time. One day I was running late and they kept their shop open until I arrived. I cannot say enough good things about this shop and the employees! I highly recommend them and only wish they were in Fairhope!! You will love their friendliness and professionalism !

name: Tammy Jones
text: Took a older sewing  machine in to get a cord for it, not only did they find a cord they also oiled the machine, getting ready to upgrade my embroidery machine and I’ll go here first to see if they have what I’m looking for and in my price range.

resp.text: Thank you I appreciate it and I try to take care of my customers and I am glad you are happy be safe and have fun making Masks

name: Ben Martin
text: I don't understand how previous posts could be negative. We purchased an embroidery machine from them 15+ years ago and have since moved out of state. They were extremely nice when we purchased the machine so we called them in hopes they could help us with a service question. Our local dealer wanted $75 just to look at the machine and couldn't advise us about how to troubleshoot it to see if it was even worth the effort since it was an electronic issue (calibration problem). They could only tell us a new board would be around $600. When we called American Appliance, the service technician and another staff person were eager to help us over the phone and guided us through the steps on how to reset the calibration on the screen. We mixed up the steps- our fault- which led to 4 more short return calls and each time they were still very willing to get us back on track and help us. In less than 30 minutes, we were up and running with perfect calibration- and it saved us $675. They could have taken the easy route on a busy Saturday morning and told us to go to the local dealer or buy a new screen but they were genuinely interested in helping us and their extra service efforts are very much appreciated!

name: Neil Cater
text: Always have what I need in stock. Long time Oreck fan and since Mobile's Oreck store closed they've kept my favorite vac supplied with bags, belts, and whatever else I might need to keep my OCD self happy!

name: Stephanie Bassenger
text: I wouldn't even check off a star if I could avoid it.  American Sew and Vac has disappointed me for the last time.  Four months ago I went to a serger class, that was a good class, but during this class I discovered I needed a fabric guide for my serger.  I requested the part to be ordered that very night.  I have since called and requested this part 4 more times, once even going back to the shop to do so.  Each time I'm told that they just got inventory in and to let them check, then I never get a call back.  I have decided it will be quicker to ride over to Mississippi to another Babylock dealer to get my service and parts.  I would never recommend this dealer, however, they are the nearest to me for quite a few miles.  Sad.

resp.text: Sometimes life happens you had a good class and that’s what you wanted and obviously the teacher showed you new accessories for your serger fabric guides despite ordering we often back ordered items which I have no control over the dealer in Mississippi just had not sold all of their seam guides out and had to reorder or they would had the same problem with getting one as well You had a good Class and learned that is what is important not something we were out of stock on and it was back ordered that is called life

name: Arnold Singleton
text: (×××××)to God be glory A_S_&_V )

name: Fairhope Sewing School Fairhope, AL
text: Always been very fair, helpful and gone beyond what others have done.  Would recommend them to anyone.

name: Debbie Hudgens
text: Always so helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly!

name: Peggy Stone
text:
I first purchased my machine 25 years ago. Took it in during the summer for full service, when I picked it up only oiled and oil was coating every service. $50 for this.
The only reason I bought from them to begin with was they were the only Bernina dealer.

resp.text: Oil is a necessary part of older mechanical machines we do our best to clean any excess oil up and sometimes after cleaning up a machine if it sits for a while sometimes oil will settle on something. I apologize for any excess oil we try to do our best.

name: paula dixon
text: Dont know nothing about this store

resp.text: Ok, well we sell and fix sewing machines and vacuum cleaners and supplies for both but thank you for your review

name: John F. Helmer
text:
The tarp I ordered is outstanding. Great material and quality workmanship.

I especially appreciate the feedback and advice I got from both Rob and Josh.

Lookout Mountain Tarp does good work!

Thank you.

name: Anita Dickerson
text: Great Tarp! Fits like a glove! Exceeded our expectations.

name: Randy Green
text: Great ,  very intelligent  young men

name: Angela Reynolds
text: Always friendly and they are ready on the spot to help I have never waited for service

name: Loretta Schafer
text: If you're looking for a good tarp that will last this is a good place to go.

name: DALLAS TUCK
text: Bought a coil tarp a couple moths ago and just used it.  Very pleased, and the customer service was very help full and understanding

name: jonah thompson
text: Love it

name: A. Peaden
text: Good prices well stocked
